intro: Pappobolus robinsonii, commonly known as the Robinson's pappobolus, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, fluffy seed heads that resemble small parachutes. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
